David

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Sure, but why a monk?  You'll be deprived of the monk progression and much better AB (BAB).

Does the staff have some sort of prereq that makes so many monk levels that attractive?  I'd think some sort of WM (monkish or otherwise) would be optimal. That d6 20x2 crit will be needing help that even ultra STR won't compensate that much.

Are you looking for a DevCrit build, David?

Remember that if not DEX-based, your 2H attack will have serious AC issues.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
Why a Monk. Because the Staff requires it. You can't equip it unless you have 25 levels of monk.
As far as I know you can't use weapon finesse with a staff. Because of that one would have to
build a str monk. If a monk wears anything but light armour they lose certain Monk abilities.

How can i build a str Monk with 25 levels monk without wearing heavy armour??

David

That would end up starting at STR 18, DEX 16, CON 18, WIS 17, INT 12, CHA 11... like I (and Empyre said) too many odd abilities. I believe my split is better optimized because you need not waste a INT bump to qualify for Expertise and also gain a better skill set. You'll be wanting, at minimum, tumble 40, spellcraft 43 (45), disc 43, listen 43 and max conc if taunting is a factor.  I don't see your build getting to the 40 naked AC milestone you declared either.  10 + 5 dex + 3 wis + 8 tumble + 4 rdd +5 monk +2 as = 37.

And why so much starting CON?

How do you get that extra feat with celestial race?  I don't see it mentioned in the description.  Neither the extra skill points.  Those are only human racial benefits.

Since the RDD fire immunity overrides the celestial fire vulnerability, you need not be concerned with reflex evasion vs. all fire-based evocation attacks.  That negates a major portion of artillery spellcasting threats.

One thing you might think about is going monk 1 to 20 pre-epic to get BAB 15 and increase your overall AB by 1 (along with the +1 AC by Level 20) then getting your sorc prereq at 21 followed by rdd with occasional monk dumps in between. Until you qualify to equip the uber staff I'd be using unarmed attacks vs. creature weapons even without the +1 focus or extended crit range.  It would still be better with the monk -3 progression than the staff's -5 anyway and if you adopt my suggestion about keeping WIS high, a very effective Stunning Fist DC.  Prowess comes too late to be much use AB-wise but with all that STR, the extra attacks with d20 (5-6 APR vs. 3 APR) will keep pace with the staff's damage for all of pre-epic while the STR modifier has not yet fully matured.  You can always switch to the staff to attempt disarm spams vs. small/tiny weapons but vs. other size wpns (and especially creature weapons), the unarmed disarm is just as effective.

edit:  One thing I figured should be obvious but perhaps it is not... those ability totals STR+1 * 4, WIS+1 * 6, Grt WIS * 6...

you can toggle them any way you decide is the best AB-to-AC ratio.  Just make sure to toggle in pairs.  For example, the Grt abilities could just as easily been allocated as Grt STR * 4, Grt WIS * 2 which translates into +2 AB/dmg and -2 AC. And the same goes for the bumps.. Always swap in pairs.

posts.content:
I still think that AB needs some serious help.  With all that CHA (from the subrace) you could get a taunt boost of 6 by using bard instead of sorc.  All you would lose is a couple casts of True Strike and gain the AB boost from bard song that lasts 10 rounds.  At least Bard 2: one to qualify for RDD and the other a late taunt dump.  I don't see much value in striving for RDD 14 because it won't change your AC, just get a bonus feat. 

Monk 20 pre-epic is still better.  I'd wait until epic to quaify for RDD.  With such a low AB, every 5% better chance to hit matters.   You won't be getting the monk progression, so right now as it stands, the progression will be +37/+32/+27.  Aiming for that 40 AC is a grand target but not if your toon can't hit anything.  It's easy enough to just trade off 2 Great WIS for Great STR to compensate for the lost Epic Prowess.  39 AC is not horrible but 37 AB is.  Now if that staff happens to have a +20 enhancement on it (and I'm betting it has something like that), all your AB concerns are over, right?

If you decide to go with taunting, make sure to max Concentration as well unless there are no counter taunt threats on your server.

BTW, it looks like you've mastered adding custom subrace adjustments to the CBC.  Congratulations!  With all those subraces, it will come in handy to design builds quickly.
